page.title: 19Morgan family, Thornton
page.content: Mrs Morgan's family have lived in Thornton since 1661.In the 17th and 18th Century they were lords of Sinnington, Normanby and Thornton.In 1925 they sold their land to the Forestry Commission. In the 17th Century the population of Thornton was only about 1300 but today has risen to 2000.Her grandfather built the Memorial Hall and gave it to the post office. Under her dining-room was once a tiny prison,known as the "Black Hole".Mrs Morgan,who is very fond of the area, is the patron of Thornton Dale and Ellerburn and she appointed the new vicar,Reverend Clements. She still owns 7 farms,all the woodland around Thornton except Dalby(this was sold in 1925),Pexton, 5 cottages. Her estate totals about 2000 acres.
